alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 3:24AM CDT until September 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, McCurtain. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Sherwood, Mount Herman, Hochatown, Bethel, Smithville, Battiest, Watson, Plunketville, Pickens and Eagletown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
